block.p: Erica Leslie Youngren, a daughter of Dr. Virginia Rotan Youngren and Dr. William T. H. Youngren of West Newton, Mass., was married yesterday to Craig Thomas Abruzzo, a son of Rose Abruzzo of Farmington, Conn., and Anthony Abruzzo of Simsbury, Conn. The Rev. Edward Anderson performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Church in Nantucket, Mass.

Ms. Youngren, 28, is keeping her name. She was until recently a fashion writer at Harper's Bazaar magazine in New York. She graduated from Vassar. Her father teaches English and musicology at Boston College in Chestnut Hill, Mass., and is a music critic for Atlantic Monthly. Her mother is a psychologist at McLean Hospital in Belmont, Mass., and a clinical instructor of psychology at Harvard Medical School.

Erica Leslie Youngren, a daughter of Dr. Virginia Rotan Youngren and Dr. William T. H. Youngren of West Newton, Mass., was married yesterday to Craig Thomas Abruzzo, a son of Rose Abruzzo of Farmington, Conn., and Anthony Abruzzo of Simsbury, Conn. The Rev. Edward Anderson performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Church in Nantucket, Mass.

Ms. Youngren, 28, is keeping her name. She was until recently a fashion writer at Harper's Bazaar magazine in New York. She graduated from Vassar. Her father teaches English and musicology at Boston College in Chestnut Hill, Mass., and is a music critic for Atlantic Monthly. Her mother is a psychologist at McLean Hospital in Belmont, Mass., and a clinical instructor of psychology at Harvard Medical School.

Mr. Abruzzo, 31, manages documentation of stock derivatives at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter, the stock brokerage house. Until earlier this month he worked in New York; he is to begin in the firm's London office in October. He graduated summa cum laude from Drew University and received a law degree from New York University. His father is an owner of the Hartford Gage Company, an industrial gauge manufacturer in West Hartford.
